articles.author: HALELUYA HADERO and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump asked the Supreme Court on Friday to pause the potential TikTok ban from going into effect until his administration can pursue a “political resolution” to the issue. The request came as TikTok and the Biden administration filed opposing briefs to the court, in which the company argued the court should strike down a law that could ban the platform by Jan.
articles.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to delay TikTok ban so he can weigh in after he takes office

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Five months after their shock offensive into Russia, Ukrainian troops are bloodied and demoralized by the rising risk of defeat in Kursk, a region some want to hold at all costs while others question the value of having gone in at all.
articles.title: Bloodied Ukrainian troops risk losing more hard-won land in Kursk to Russia

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The United States is expected to announce that it will send $1.25 billion in military assistance to Ukraine, U.S. officials said Friday, as the Biden administration pushes to get as much aid to Kyiv as possible before leaving office on Jan.
articles.title: US to send $1.25 billion in weapons to Ukraine, pushing to get aid out before Biden leaves office

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — An online spat between factions of Donald Trump's supporters over immigration and the tech industry has thrown internal divisions in his political movement into public display, previewing the fissures and contradictory views his coalition could bring to the White House.
articles.title: An online debate over foreign workers in tech shows tensions in Trump's political coalition

articles.author: ROB GILLIES
articles.description: TORONTO (AP) — Two Canadian Cabinet ministers left a meeting at Mar-a-Lago on Friday without assurances President-elect Donald Trump will back away from threatened tariffs on all products from the major American trading partner.
articles.title: Canadian Cabinet ministers meet with Trump's nominee for commerce secretary in bid to avoid tariffs

articles.author: EDITH M. LEDERER
articles.description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — Israeli airstrikes hit Yemen’s main airport as a civilian Airbus 320 with hundreds of passengers on board was landing and a U.N.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes hit a Yemen airport as a jet with hundreds onboard was landing, UN official says

articles.author: AIJAZ HUSSAIN
articles.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — Manmohan Singh, the former Indian prime minister widely regarded as the architect of the country’s economic reform program, was cremated after a state funeral on Saturday as politicians and the public mourned his death.
articles.title: Former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who instituted economic reforms, cremated in New Delhi

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — At least one Mega Millions player has plenty of dough to ring in the New Year after drawing the winning number. After three months without anyone winning the top prize in the lottery, a ticket worth an estimated $1.22 billion was sold in California for the drawing Friday night, according to the Mega Millions website.
articles.title: Winning ticket for $1.22 billion lottery jackpot sold in California, Mega Millions says

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A ninth U.S. telecoms firm has been confirmed to have been hacked as part of a sprawling Chinese espionage campaign that gave officials in Beijing access to private texts and phone conversations of an unknown number of Americans, a top White House official said Friday.
articles.title: A 9th telecoms firm has been hit by a massive Chinese espionage campaign, the White House says

articles.author: HALLIE GOLDEN
articles.description: Greg Gumbel, a longtime CBS sportscaster who broke barriers during his career calling some of the biggest sporting events, has died from cancer, according to a statement from family released by the network on Friday.
articles.title: Sportscaster Greg Gumbel dies from cancer at age 78
